argument.description: The substring to find. All occurrences of from_substring found within string are replaced with to_substring.
The replacement substring. All occurrences of from_substring found within string are replaced with to_substring.

description: The PostgreSQL replace function replaces all occurrences of a specified string.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT replace('techonthenet.com', 'techonthenet', 'checkyourmath');
      replace
-------------------
 checkyourmath.com
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT replace('TechOnTheNet.com', 'techonthenet', 'checkyourmath');
      replace
-------------------
 TechOnTheNet.com
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT replace('abc abc', 'a', 'B');
 replace
---------
 Bbc Bbc
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT replace('abc abc', 'A', 'B');
 replace
---------
 abc abc
(1 row)
